name: Restlet Framework
short_description:
Restlet Framework is a mature, secure and scalable open source software that lets Java developers all over the world expose and consume RESTful web APIs.

Available in six editions, including Java SE, Java EE, Android, GWT, GAE and OSGi, Restlet Framework is used by thousands of organizations, including startups like RunMyProcess and large companies such as Google, LinkedIn or NASA.

In September 2012, after two years of development, version 2.1 of Restlet Framework was released, along with the "Restlet in action" book published by Manning. The book covers Restlet development in details and gives perspective on the future road map and the place of APISpark (Restlet's full-stack web API platform). The book also describes ROA/D, their field-proven methodology that helps to design and build successful web APIs.
summary: Open source software to expose and consume RESTful web APIs for Java.
